verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
tam āha bhagavān hṛṣṭaḥ
kṛtāsana-parigrahaḥ
megha-gambhīrayā vācā
sa-smitaṁ kuru-nandana

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; tam—to him; āha—said; bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; hṛṣṭaḥ—pleased; kṛta—having done; āsana—of a seat; parigrahaḥ—the acceptance; megha—like a cloud; gambhīrayā—deep; vācā—in a voice; sa—with; smitam—a smile; kuru—of the Kurus; nandana—O beloved descendant.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: O beloved descendant of Kuru, the Supreme Lord was pleased, and after accepting a comfortable seat He smiled and addressed the King in a voice as deep as the rumbling of a cloud.
